results.title: Destination: Port of Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Norman Godbold and Pan Pacific Pictures
results.brief_description: Follows the docking of a container ship. Aerial views show the layout of the port and ground shots provide a feeling of great activity in the port.

results.title: Out of slavery: 1619-1860
results.creator_credit: Alvin Yudkoff, Milton Meltzer and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Effective use of illustrations and still photographs, coupled with powerful music, to describe the period from the beginning of the slave trade with Africa to the election of Abraham Lincoln. Deals with the role of the War of Independence and the Declaration of Independence in the abolition of slavery. Also the growth of the southern cotton industry, underground railway, and northern abolitionists. Narrated by James Earl Jones. Suitable for upper primary and secondary school levels.

results.title: Mr Koumal flies like a bird
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Sim Productions and Studio Animovaneho Filmu
results.brief_description: Mr Koumal has his heart set on flying like a bird. His repeated attempts end in disaster. Ultimately the irrepressible Mr Koumal finds a way out. He sells the feathers he has used for wings to an Indian head-dress shop.

results.title: A meal at Francis' = Un repas chez Francis
results.creator_credit: John Seabourne and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: An American girl and her French friend have lunch together in Paris. They look for a restaurant and then the American girl is shown how to order a meal, name foods and beverages, the French girl also explains French eating habits all carried out in simple slowly-spoken French.

results.title: Maria of the Pueblos
results.brief_description: Centres on the life of Maria Martinez, who is probably the world’s most successful Indian potter. Tells how Maria accidentally rediscovered the secret of recreating iridescent black pottery, and unselfishly shard it to life her village out of poverty.

results.title: Phoebe
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film story exploring the state of mind of a teenage girl when she learns she is pregnant. The film slips in and out of the present, past and future in a way that communicates her feelings in an almost subjective way. Her need to tell her parents, her boyfriend, her school principal, and to find some help in her predicament is the heart of the film. Cast: Bernard Blumer, Yael Brandeis, John Kastner, Dona Saunders, Sandra Scott, Kay Tremblay. (Awards: Five including Montreal; New York)

results.title: David Lean: a self portrait
results.creator_credit: Thomas Craven and Thomas Craven Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A comprehensive documentary made in collaboration with the noted director at work on the set, on location, and in the editing room, as he explains his viewpoint about the film and his method of work. Illustrates with excerpt from several of Lean’s films, which together have won a number of awards. Includes interviews with Sam Spiegel who produced some of Lean’s early films and Robert Bolt who wrote the scripts for Lean’s last three films.

results.title: Sergeant Swell of the Mounties
results.creator_credit: Chuck Menville, Len Janson and Pending Productions
results.brief_description: A spoof on the Royal Canadian Mounted Police in which our hero, Sergeant Swell, finds himself at odds with a local Indian tribe and a warrior who always seems to be just a few steps behind. Includes the ‘cliche’ lady in perpetual distress who requires continuous rescuing by the incompetent Swell.

results.title: The Juggler of Notre Dame
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of Anatole France’s story of a juggler named Barnaby who is given shelter in a monastery. To start with, the seemingly worthless Barnaby and his antics displease the monks, but one night his juggling causes a miracle, and the monks realise the worth of Barnaby and his talent. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Maths with everything
results.creator_credit: John Krish, John Arnold and A Graphic Film
results.brief_description: Demonstrates British child centred methods of teaching mathematics to children aged five to seven. The film’s point is that maths includes all activities if teachers know where to look for opportunities to teach it, using experiences that interest and totally involve the children. Explores thematic approach to mathematics. Begins with an in-service program for infant teachers. They construct a mural and then proceed to discover maths in it. A class teacher in a school situation then adopts the same approach using the theme ‘buses’.
